oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Three buttons recovered from Sequatchie County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two Confedrete buttons recovered fom the Sequatchie River Valley and one civilian coin button. The button on the left is a cast brass "I" button. The "I" stood for Infantry. The button on the right bears the Georgia state seal. State buttons were often used by soldiers from the respective states. The civilan button in the center was made in England by Bielby, Hyde & Co. of Birmingham, England. The manufacturing dates to the 1820s or 1830s.
